ALLEGATION:
Facility has not submitted adoption records to MDHHS for permanent
retention one year following the final order of adoption as required.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the Chief Administrator and she reported there were eight adoption
files that had not been returned to the local offices. She reported the files were all
submitted to their respective local DHHS offices as of this date. She reported that
2

One adoption file was submitted to Saginaw DHHS office on 6/9/2022; three
adoption files were submitted to Oakland County DHHS office on 6/10/2022; three
adoption files were submitted to Wayne County DHHS local office on 6/7/2022; and
one case file was submitted to Benzie County on 6/2/2022. All of the adoption case
files were submitted by the agency adoption specialist and signed by the local DHHS
offices in the respective counties. These receipts of submission were verified as
received by this Consultant. There were no other late adoption case files.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
ANALYSIS:
The Facility has not submitted records to MDHHS for permanent
retention one year following the final order of adoption as
required. There were eight adoption case files that had not
been submitted timely. Therefore, the agency is in violation with
this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
